p: The rehydrogenation of the LiAlH 4-LiBH 4 mixtures was proven to occur at various conditions of pressure and temperature, among them 40, 70, and 85 bar, and 350, 400, and 600 Â°C [ 97, 98, 99]. The rehydrogenation is directed to the formation of LiBH 4, since no rehydrogenation of LiAlH 4 has reported. While using NaBH 4 instead of LiBH 4 conduces to similar conclusions; a two-step dehydrogenation with reduced temperature as compared with pure materials, the presence of AlB 2 after dehydrogenation, and partial hydrogenation due to the formation of NaBH 4 [ 102].
